{{Infobox album | | Artist = [[Jerry Goldsmith]] | Name = Alien | Type = Soundtrack | Cover = jerry goldsmith-alien score 1979.jpg | Released = 1979 | Genre = [[Avant-garde]]
[[Classical music|Classical]] | Length = 33:37 ''Original''
126:18 ''Complete Edition'' | Label = 20th Century Records ''Original'' T-593
Intrada ''Complete Edition'' | Producer = Jerry Goldsmith | Misc = {{Extra chronology | Artist = ''Alien'' film series soundtrack | Type = soundtrack | Last album = | This album = '''''Alien'''''
(1979) | Next album = ''[[Aliens (soundtrack)|Aliens]]''
(1987) }} {{Extra album cover | Upper caption = Alternative cover | Type = soundtrack | Cover = jerry goldsmith-alien score complete intrada edition.jpg | Lower caption = Cover of the Intrada ''Complete Edition'' | Border = yes }} }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|5|5}}[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r84171|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic review] | rev2 = [[Filmtracks.com|Filmtracks]] | rev2Score = {{Rating|3|5}}[http://www.filmtracks.com/titles/alien.html Filmtracks review] | rev3 = Soundtrack-express | rev3Score = {{Rating|5|5}}[http://www.soundtrack-express.com/osts/alien.htm Soundtrack-express review] | rev4 = [[Soundtrack.net]] | rev4Score = {{Rating|5|5}}[http://www.soundtrack.net/albums/database/?id=4700&page=review Soundtrack.net] }} The iconic, [[avant-garde]] score to the film ''[[Alien (film)|Alien]]'' was composed by [[Jerry Goldsmith]] and is considered by some to be one of his best, most visceral scores.[http://www.soundtrack-express.com/osts/alien.htm Alien - Jerry Goldsmith] Rather than focusing on themes, Goldsmith creates a bleak and dissonant soundscape that fits the film's dark and intense atmosphere, with only a few "romantic" cues.[http://scoresheet.tripod.com/Reviews/alien.html A L I E N by Jerry Goldsmith][http://www.soundtrack-express.com/osts/alien.htm Alien - Jerry Goldsmith] ==Background== The music was performed by the [[National Philharmonic Orchestra]] and conducted by [[Lionel Newman]]. However, the music was not originally used or heard as intended. The score was substantially cut for the film's released versions, and some recordings from other sources were added, notably portions of Goldsmith's original score for the 1962 film ''[[Freud the Secret Passion|Freud]]'' (which were that film's ''Main Title'', as well as the tracks ''Charcot's Show'' and ''Desperate Case''Kirgo, Julie (2009). Booklet to the 2009 Deluxe Edition of the OST to ''Freud'', published by [[Varèse Sarabande Records]] and [[USI B Music Publishing]] (BMI)), and the first movement ([[wikt:adagio|adagio]]) from [[Howard Hanson]]'s 1930 "Symphony No. 2, Romantic" for the film's end credits.{{cite web|title=Great American composers| url=http://classicalcdreview.com/hanson.html}} The complete intended score was first released as an isolated track on a 1999 20th Anniversary DVD edition on [[20th Century Fox Home Entertainment]] (it has subsequently appeared on budget DVD and Blu-ray releases of the film). On November 15, 2007, [[Intrada Records]] released this same intended score with additional alternate score tracks and the original LP program in a 2-CD set. This release is the first to publish Jerry Goldsmith's complete score remixed and remastered from the original 1" master tapes. [[Mondo Gearing]] re-released the soundtrack, in summer 2015 with a new artwork designed by [[Tyler Stout]].{{cite web|title= Mondo Gearing Up To Release ‘Alien’ Soundtrack| url=http://bloody-disgusting.com/news/3330065/mondo-gearing-release-alien-soundtrack/}} ==Track listing== ===Original track listing=== {{Tracklist | title1 = Main Title | length1 = 3:30 | title2 = The Face Hugger | length2 = 2:32 | title3 = Breakway | length3 = 7:34 | title4 = Acid Test | length4 = 4:35 | title5 = The Landing | length5 = 4:29 | title6 = The Droid | length6 = 4:40 | title7 = The Recovery | length7 = 2:44 | title8 = The Alien Planet | length8 = 2:28 | title9 = The Shaft | length9 = 3:57 | title10 = End Title | length10 = 3:02 }} ===Complete edition track listing=== :'''Disc ==Credits == credits for the original edition by 20th Century Records[http://www.discogs.com/Jerry-Goldsmith-Alien-Original-Motion-Picture-Soundtrack/release/728368 Jerry Goldsmith: Alien (Original Motion Picture Soundtrack)] *Conductor – Lionel Newman *Engineer [Mixing Engineer] – [[Eric Arthur Tomlinson|Eric Tomlinson]] *Orchestra – The National Philharmonic Orchestra *Orchestrated By – Arthur Morton *Producer, Composed By – Jerry Goldsmith *Remix, Edited By – Len Engel ==References== {{reflist}} {{Alien}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alien (Soundtrack)}} [[Category:Alien (franchise) soundtracks]]
